DOC.brief_summary: To investigate whether body acupuncture of acupuncture points specific for hearing influences the auditory avoked potentials in comparison to puncture of non-specific acupuncture points
DOC.criteria: 1. Healthy volunteers aged 2040 years 2. Physical status I according to American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) classification 3. No history of nervous or psychiatric disease 4. Normal audiogram before the study 5. No chronic consume of analgesics, anticoagulants and/or antiplatelet agents, sedatives or alcohol 6. No local infection at the site of acupuncture 7. Volunteers who have given informed consent 1. Pregnant or nursing females. 2. History of peripheral neuropathy 3. Abnormal skin conditions (infection, scars, psoriasis, eczema) 4. Inflamed site of acupuncture within 1 week
